trans-unit.source: Operations on DocumentDB Offers
trans-unit.target: Operations on DocumentDB Offers

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB API supports basic CRUD operations on the resources under a database account.

trans-unit.source: This topic outlines the operations that can be executed on a DocumentDB offer.Each DocumentDB account supports multiple independent named databases.
trans-unit.target: This topic outlines the operations that can be executed on a DocumentDB offer.Each DocumentDB account supports multiple independent named databases.

trans-unit.source: A database is a logical container of document storage, partitioned across collections.
trans-unit.target: A database is a logical container of document storage, partitioned across collections.

trans-unit.source: A collection is a container of JSON documents and associated JavaScript application logic, i.e. stored procedures, triggers and user-defined functions.
trans-unit.target: A collection is a container of JSON documents and associated JavaScript application logic, i.e. stored procedures, triggers and user-defined functions.

trans-unit.source: Each collection must be associated to an offer resource that dictates the performance level and storage preserved for the collection.
trans-unit.target: Each collection must be associated to an offer resource that dictates the performance level and storage preserved for the collection.

trans-unit.source: When a creating a collection, the header x-ms-offer-type can be used to set the offer type for the collection, e.g. S1, S2 and S3.
trans-unit.target: When a creating a collection, the header x-ms-offer-type can be used to set the offer type for the collection, e.g. S1, S2 and S3.

trans-unit.source: If the header is not set, S1 will be the default offer.
trans-unit.target: If the header is not set, S1 will be the default offer.

trans-unit.source: The offer resource is represented by offers in the DocumentDB resource model.
trans-unit.target: The offer resource is represented by offers in the DocumentDB resource model.

trans-unit.source: Here’s an example of the URI: https://mydbaccount.documents.azure.com/offers.
trans-unit.target: Here’s an example of the URI: https://mydbaccount.documents.azure.com/offers.

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of an offer:
trans-unit.target: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of an offer:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: offerType
trans-unit.target: offerType

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: The valid values are S1, S2 and S3.
trans-unit.target: The valid values are S1, S2 and S3.

trans-unit.source: The value must be capitalized.
trans-unit.target: The value must be capitalized.

trans-unit.source: For more information on performance levels, please see DocumentDB performance levels.
trans-unit.target: For more information on performance levels, please see DocumentDB performance levels.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: During creation of a collection, this property is automatically associated to the self link of collection associated to the offer resource, i.e. dbs/pLJdAA==/colls/pLJdAOlEdgA=/.
trans-unit.target: During creation of a collection, this property is automatically associated to the self link of collection associated to the offer resource, i.e. dbs/pLJdAA==/colls/pLJdAOlEdgA=/.

trans-unit.source: offerResourceId
trans-unit.target: offerResourceId

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: During creation of a collection, this property is automatically associated to the resource id, i.e. _rid of collection associated to the offer resource.
trans-unit.target: During creation of a collection, this property is automatically associated to the resource id, i.e. _rid of collection associated to the offer resource.

trans-unit.source: The resource id must match collection _rid in the resource property.
trans-unit.target: The resource id must match collection _rid in the resource property.

trans-unit.source: In the example above, the _rid for the collection is pLJdAOlEdgA=.
trans-unit.target: In the example above, the _rid for the collection is pLJdAOlEdgA=.

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The id for the offer resource is automatically generated when it is created.
trans-unit.target: The id for the offer resource is automatically generated when it is created.

trans-unit.source: It has the same value as the _rid for the offer.
trans-unit.target: It has the same value as the _rid for the offer.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the offer.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the offer.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
